title: Riot needs to add another way to resize the ingame shop
body:
Okay, I've been playing on my laptop recently and it has a tiny screen resolution compared to the monitor of my PC on which I usually play.  The problem with that was when I load up LOL the bottom part of the ingame item shop doesn't show up on my screen... so I couldn't resize it via the mouse because the mouse couldn't get to the one area to resize its height.  I mean literally more than half of the buttons for selling and undoing were off the bottom of my screen.

In the end, I had to make the game windowed, lower the resolution even more, that forced my shop to resize itself, and then go back to my normal settings.  Even though I could work around it, that wasn't the most intuitive option nor did I have any guarantee that it would work.  

Can riot please add an easier way of resizing the shop for rare instances like the one I faced?

replies.body:
You might see resolution issues if you are using a 4K monitor, which is not something we currently support.  Aside from that, a resent Windows update has also caused some resolution issues, which we've found a workaround for:

Right click the LoL icon -> Properties -> Compatibility Tab -> Check the "Disable Display Scaling on High DPI Settings" Box.

I hope that helps!
Nope, I went from 1920 x 1200 to 1366 x 768 and the issue popped up.

Thanks for the update!  Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can help out with your case individually.  You can also give some more context by attaching a set of logs that can be obtained via the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367).  We'll respond asap!
